text: When I notice concerns about co-parenting dynamics, I recognize them and choose to address them constructively instead.
During moments when co-parenting feels chaotic, I notice the tension and choose to work toward stability instead.
When I feel the pull to react emotionally during co-parenting, I notice it and choose to stay calm and clear instead.
I let co-parenting dynamics become chaotic and prevent us from forming a stable team.
When I notice patterns that support stable co-parenting, I recognize them and choose to strengthen them.
I see when co-parenting needs attention, and I choose to work together to build stability instead of letting chaos grow.
When I feel the urge to let old relationship patterns affect co-parenting, I notice it and choose to separate them instead.
I let concerns about team stability prevent me from identifying and working toward stable co-parenting dynamics.
When I notice co-parenting communication becoming tense, I pause and choose to respond with clarity instead.
I recognize when co-parenting challenges come from old patterns rather than present needs, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the pull to avoid working on co-parenting, I notice it and choose to address issues directly instead.
I let chaotic dynamics prevent me from working with my partner to form a stable co-parenting team.
When I notice stability building in co-parenting, I recognize it and choose to maintain and strengthen it.
I see when co-parenting needs better communication, and I choose to work together to improve it.
When I feel the urge to let conflict affect co-parenting, I notice it and choose to prioritize stability instead.
I let not identifying team dynamics prevent me from forming a stable co-parenting team.
When I notice co-parenting working well, I recognize it and choose to build on those patterns.
I recognize when co-parenting struggles come from communication issues, and I choose to address them constructively.
When I feel the pull to let personal feelings interfere with co-parenting, I notice it and choose to separate them instead.
I let concerns about team stability prevent me from working together to form a stable co-parenting dynamic.
